alert.note: Alert for Orange (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 19 at 2:36AM EST until December 19 at 11:08AM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Vermont... Wells River At Wells River affecting Orange County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Wells River at Wells River. * WHEN...Until late this morning. * IMPACTS...Until the river stage falls below 6.0 feet, water will continue to approach US Highway 302 along the river in Groton, South Ryegate, and Wells River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:45 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 6.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:45 AM EST Tuesday was 7.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early this morning and continue falling to 3.5 feet Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 6.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.2 feet on 04/15/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this morning at 1115 AM EST.
